headache.description: Pain in the head or neck region

urgency.<24h: Rest, hydrate, and monitor. Use OTC pain relievers like acetaminophen.
urgency.24h-72h: Consult a doctor if pain worsens.

headache.when_to_see_doctor: If accompanied by vomiting, vision changes, or confusion.

urgency.immediate: Call emergency services. Could indicate heart attack.

urgency.<3_days: Rest, hydrate, and monitor. Use acetaminophen.
urgency.>3_days: Consult a doctor for persistent fever.

dizziness.when_to_see_doctor: If accompanied by chest pain or fainting.

ibuprofen.precautions: Avoid with alcohol or blood thinners

metformin.precautions: Not for patients with kidney disease

amoxicillin.precautions: Complete full course to avoid resistance

interactions.amoxicillin,probiotics: Probiotics may reduce antibiotic effectiveness (take 2 hours apart)

management.diet: Low glycemic index foods, portion control

management.emergency: Use rescue inhaler. Go to ER if no improvement.

depression.action: Consult a licensed therapist for evaluation

cbc.purpose: Evaluate overall health and detect anemia, infection

sources.disclaimer: This is sample data. Always consult a licensed physician.
